Let $X$ be a set where $\left| X \right|=n \in \mathbb{N}$, we say a k-combination is any subset of $X$ who's cardinality is $k$, the number of $k$-combinations is equal to 
\[
	{{}^{n}\!C_{k}} \stackrel{\mathtt{N}}{=} \binom{n}{k} \stackrel{\mathtt{D}}{=}\frac{n \left( n-1 \right) \dotsb \left( n -k  + 1 \right)}{k \left( k-1 \right)\dotsb 1} = \frac{n!}{(n-k)!\cdot k!} 
\]
